Package logic.Controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Controller.Controller
  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    The Controller implements the game logic and alters the game model. It also reacts to incoming messages from the NetworkHandler.
    Author:
    Adrian, Luka Stoehr

      Handles a MoveRequest by checking if it is the Players and its respective Heroes turn and then calling the Hero.move() method if the request was valid.

      Handles a RangedAttackRequest by checking the request and starting the RangedAttack (also called farAttack in Model) if the request was valid.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller​(Configuration configuration)
        Constructor for the Controller class.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        public HandleReturn startGame()
        This method starts a new match. It spawns all Rocks and Heroes, creates a turnOrder for the first round and calls the goose() method for the first time. If this method is called while a match is already running, it returns a HandleReturn object containing requestSuccessful=false.
        Returns:
        HandleReturn object containing all events that have occurred

      • nextRound

        public void nextRound()
        This method starts the next round. It decides on a new turnOrder randomly, resets MPs and APs of Heroes and resets the turnCount and creates a RoundSetupEvent. Furthermore it checks which NPCs are active in this round, places them in the turnOrder and calls checkForNextTurn() to check if the current turn can be handled by the server itself.

      • nextTurn

        public void nextTurn()
        This method starts the next turn by creating a TurnEvent and incrementing turnCount. Before doing so, it also checks if one of the players has one. If the next turn can be handled automatically (i.e. StanLee, Goose, Thanos, knocked out character) the turn is handled and nextTurn() is called again. If the current turnOrder is completed, nextRound() is called.

      • checkForNextTurn

        public void checkForNextTurn()
        This method checks if the next turn can be started automatically if it is currently a heroes turn. This is the case if both the MovementPoints and the ActionPoints of a Hero are used up. In this case the server does not wait for an EndRoundRequest, but starts the next turn without waiting for the Player. This method is called after every processed request.

      • playerKicked

        public HandleReturn playerKicked​(Player player)
        This method lets the other player win if one of the players was kicked from the match, for example due to a protocol violation. It is similar to the method handleRequest(Player player, DisconnectRequest request).
        Parameters:
        player - The player that has been kicked
        Returns:
        Handle Return containing success=true and all the events that have occurred

      • handleRequest

        public HandleReturn handleRequest​(Player player,
                                  Message request)
        This method is called by the NetworkHandler, if a Request should be processed. This method then calls a handleRequest2() method, according to the received Request. This method (handleRequest(Player, Message) only exists for synchronization purposes.
        Parameters:
        player - Player object, if processing request requires it. Null otherwise
        request - Message Object containing the request
        Returns:
        HandleReturn containing a boolean indication whether the request was processed successful and all occurred Events

      • handleRequest2

        public HandleReturn handleRequest2​(Player player,
                                   DisconnectRequest request)
        Handles a DisconnectRequest by a player and lets the other player win.
        Parameters:
        player - the player who sent the request to the server
        request - the request object itself
        Returns:
        Handle Return containing success=true and all the events that have occurred

      • handleRequest2

        public HandleReturn handleRequest2​(Player player,
                                   EndRoundRequest request)
        Ends the turn for the current Character.
        Parameters:
        player - the player who sent the request to the server
        request - the request object itself
        Returns:
        HandleReturn containing the boolean success and an EventList with all new Events

      • handleRequest2

        public HandleReturn handleRequest2​(Player player,
                                   ExchangeInfinityStoneRequest request)
        Handles an ExchangeInfinityStone Request by trying to transfer the stone form the origin entity to the target entity.
        Parameters:
        player - the player who sent the request to the server
        request - the request object itself
        Returns:
        HandleReturn containing the boolean success and an EventList with all new Events

      • handleRequest2

        public HandleReturn handleRequest2​(Player player,
                                   MeleeAttackRequest request)
        Handles a MeleeAttackRequest, and carries it out if the request was valid.
        Parameters:
        player - the player who sent the request to the server
        request - the request object itself
        Returns:
        HandleReturn containing the boolean success and an EventList with all new Events

      • handleRequest2

        public HandleReturn handleRequest2​(Player player,
                                   MoveRequest request)
        Handles a MoveRequest by checking if it is the Players and its respective Heroes turn and then calling the Hero.move() method if the request was valid.
        Parameters:
        player - the player who sent the request to the server
        request - the request object itself
        Returns:
        HandleReturn containing the boolean success and an EventList with all new Events

      • handleRequest2

        public HandleReturn handleRequest2​(Player player,
                                   RangedAttackRequest request)
        Handles a RangedAttackRequest by checking the request and starting the RangedAttack (also called farAttack in Model) if the request was valid.
        Parameters:
        player - the player who sent the request to the server
        request - the request object itself
        Returns:
        HandleReturn containing the boolean success and an EventList with all new Events

      • handleRequest2

        public HandleReturn handleRequest2​(Player player,
                                   Req request)
        Is called when a client sends a "Req" request, asking for a GameState. This is always allowed, as long as the Login-Phase is finished and a Game is running.
        Parameters:
        player - null
        request - the request object itself
        Returns:
        HandleReturn containing the boolean success and an EventList with all new Events

      • handleRequest2

        public HandleReturn handleRequest2​(Player player,
                                   UseInfinityStoneRequest request)
        Handles an UseInfinityStoneRequest by calling the Hero.infinteraction() method if the request is valid.
        Parameters:
        player - the player who sent the request to the server
        request - the request object itself
        Returns:
        HandleReturn containing the boolean success and an EventList with all new Events

      • createModel

        public void createModel​(Player playerOne,
                        Player playerTwo)
        The createModel method is used to create a new game model when a new game is started. This happens as soon as two players are ready and no current game is being played. At this point the Players have not chosen their Hero-Teams yet!
        Parameters:
        playerOne - The first player
        playerTwo - The other player

      • toConfigHeroArray

        public ConfigHero[] toConfigHeroArray​(Hero[] heroArray)
        This method turns an Array of Hero objects and turns returns a corresponding Array of ConfigHeroes
        Parameters:
        heroArray - an Array of Heroes
        Returns:
        returns the converted Array of ConfigHeroes

      • getGameState

        public GamestateEvent getGameState()
        This method collects all necessary information for the GamestateEvent and creates the event.
        Returns:
        GamestateEvent that represents the current state

      • checkForWinEvent

        public void checkForWinEvent()
        This method creates a WinEvent and adds it to the eventList if one of the players has won.

      • startTurnTimer

        public void startTurnTimer()
